etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin, ultimately of Germanic origin and related to wisent

definitions: a humpbacked shaggy-haired wild ox native to North America and Europe.

notes.text: Genus Bison, family Bovidae: B. bison of North American prairies (also called buffalo), and B. bonasus of European forests (also called wisent), now found only in Poland. These are sometimes regarded as a single species

shortDefinitions: humpbacked shaggy-haired wild ox native to North America
